subject: Cybersecurity
title: White Hat vs. Black Hat: The Ethics of Hacking
description: Learn White Hat vs. Black Hat: The Ethics of Hacking in one minute.

hook.text: Same skills, same tools, same techniques. The only difference between a hero and a criminal is permission.

buildup.text: White hats hack with permission to find vulnerabilities. Black hats exploit them for profit. Gray hats hack.

discovery.text: The line is legally clear but ethically blurry. A gray hat who finds a critical vulnerability in a hospital system.

twist.text: Kevin Mitnick went from the FBI's most wanted hacker to a highly paid security consultant. Same person, same skills.

climax.text: The cybersecurity industry needs hackers. The question isn't whether to hack, but how to channel that talent.

punchline.text: FBI's most wanted hacker became the industry's most wanted consultant.

quiz.question: What distinguishes a white hat hacker from a black hat hacker?
options: White hats have authorization and permission to test systems
White hats are self-taught while black hats are formally educated
